page.title: 14Salterton High Street Trade
page.content: All the shops in the High Street have a character of their own.Some were originally houses and have been converted and a few have been passed down in the family.As Salterton is a quiet sea-side town there are only a few souvenir shops. There are five banks,four sweet shops and seven antique shops.One or two of these could more usefully be used for selling toys as there are none at the moment.Also there are far too many building societies and estate agents.These could be made into something more appealing to young people such as an arcade or trendy clothes shop. The High Street is quite narrow so that there are sometimes traffic jams.Some people think there are not enough pubs but if there were more there would be more noise at night.
